intro: Hetaeria poilanei, commonly known as the Malagasy orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found exclusively in Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its flowers are small but striking, often featuring intricate patterns and a strong fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hetaeria poilanei is considered a vulnerable species.
